## ‚úÖ Setup Checklist

Follow these steps in order:

### Step 1: Create Supabase Project ‚≠ê

- [ ] Go to https://supabase.com
- [ ] Click "Sign Up"
- [ ] Create account with your email
- [ ] Verify email
- [ ] Click "Create new project"
- [ ] Set:
  - **Project Name:** `MSP Registration Database` (or similar)
  - **Password:** Create a strong password
  - **Region:** East Africa or closest to you
- [ ] Click "Create new project"
- [ ] ‚è≥ Wait 1-2 minutes for project to initialize

### Step 2: Create Database Table ‚≠ê

In your Supabase dashboard:
- [ ] Left sidebar ‚Üí Click **"SQL Editor"**
- [ ] Click **"New Query"** button
- [ ] Copy this SQL and paste it:

```sql
CREATE TABLE msp_registrations (
  id BIGINT PRIMARY KEY GENERATED ALWAYS AS IDENTITY,
  name TEXT NOT NULL,
  email TEXT NOT NULL,
  phone TEXT,
  organization TEXT NOT NULL,
  role TEXT NOT NULL,
  gender TEXT NOT NULL,
  origin TEXT NOT NULL,
  experience TEXT NOT NULL,
  interests TEXT NOT NULL,
  timestamp TEXT NOT NULL,
  created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT NOW()
);

ALTER TABLE msp_registrations ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY;

CREATE POLICY "Allow public insert" ON msp_registrations
  FOR INSERT
  WITH CHECK (TRUE);

CREATE POLICY "Allow all select" ON msp_registrations
  FOR SELECT
  USING (TRUE);
```

- [ ] Click the big blue **"Run"** button
- [ ] ‚úì Wait for "Success" message

### Step 3: Get Your Credentials ‚≠ê

In your Supabase dashboard:
- [ ] Bottom left ‚Üí Click **"Settings"** (gear icon)
- [ ] Click **"API"** tab
- [ ] Copy your **"Project URL"** (looks like: `https://xxxxx.supabase.co`)
  - Click copy button or select and copy
  - **Paste it somewhere safe temporarily**
- [ ] Copy your **"anon public"** key (long string)
  - Click copy button or select and copy
  - **Paste it somewhere safe temporarily**

### Step 4: Enter Credentials in Admin Setup ‚≠ê

On your MSP website:
- [ ] Go to **Admin ‚Üí "Setup Registration Sync"** (or `/admin-setup`)
- [ ] Paste Project URL in first field
- [ ] Paste API Key in second field
- [ ] Click **"üß™ Test Connection"**
- [ ] ‚úì Wait for: **"‚úì Successfully connected to Supabase!"**
- [ ] Click **"‚úì Save Configuration"**
- [ ] ‚úì See green success message

### Step 5: Test Registration ‚≠ê

- [ ] Go to **"Events"** page or `/events`
- [ ] Fill out form with test data:
  - Name: `John Doe`
  - Email: `john@example.com`
  - Organization: `Test Org`
  - Role: `Test Role`
  - Gender: Pick one
  - District: `Test District`
  - Experience: `Beginner`
  - Interest: `Data Collection Methods`
- [ ] Click **"Register for Workshop"**
- [ ] ‚úì See green confirmation message

### Step 6: Verify in Supabase ‚≠ê

- [ ] Go back to Supabase dashboard
- [ ] Left sidebar ‚Üí **"Table Editor"**
- [ ] Click **"msp_registrations"** table
- [ ] ‚úì **You should see your test registration!**

Your registration system is now live!

### What happens now:

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Troubleshooting

**Q: Connection test says "Table not found"**
- Make sure you ran the SQL code in Step 2
- Check the blue "Run" button was clicked
- Try refreshing Supabase

**Q: Connection test says "Invalid API key"**
- Double-check the API key is complete
- Make sure you copied the "anon public" key, not "service_role"
- Try copying again from Supabase

**Q: No registrations appearing in Supabase**
- Check browser console (F12 ‚Üí Console)
- Submit another test registration
- Refresh Supabase dashboard
- Check that table is named exactly "msp_registrations"

**Q: Still not working?**
- Check the browser console for errors (F12 ‚Üí Console tab)
- Copy-paste any error messages
- Make sure Supabase credentials are saved (check `/admin-setup` page)
